page.title: 15BIG BUSINESS IN STIBBINGTON
page.content: This local business was started in 1935 with three people, now extended to 50. In 1960 they started making different kinds of machinery. They make their own trucks, and as well as selling them they hire them out to people. To hire a truck it varies between Â£13 and Â£30 per hour. The trucks they make are mainly farming trucks, some of which are tip- ups. Altogether they make 7 types of machines and boats. All of the English trucks are electric vehicles; the rest which come from Japan, need petrol to work. The machinery is kept just past the railway station, the other half is kept near Thornhaugh. The company takes part in shows, like the East of England Show, which helps to advertise and sell their machines.
